subject: NAV
name: Naval Lab I
info: Instruction and training in basic military subjects and professional development, including military leadership, close order drill, marksmanship, honors and ceremonies, personnel inspections, and computer-based war game simulations.  Classes and small group seminars on leadership and ethical issues with case studies.prereq: enrolled in NROTC

subject: NAV
name: Intro to Naval Sci
info: Navy organization, customs and traditions, officer and enlisted rank and rating structures, uniforms and insignia, shipboard duties, seamanship, damage control, and safety. Core values of the naval services, Navy regulations, and the Uniform Code of Military Justice.

subject: NAV
name: Seapower
info: Historical influences on development of U.S. Navy, from American Revolution to present. Critical, contemporary issues.

subject: NAV
name: Naval Lab II
info: Instruction and training in basic military subjects and professional development, including military leadership, close order drill, marksmanship, honors and ceremonies, personnel inspections, and computer-based war game simulations.  Classes and small group seminars on leadership and ethical issues with case studies.prereq: Soph enrolled in NROTC

subject: NAV
name: Ship Systems I
info: Detailed study of ship characteristics/types. Design, hydrodynamic forces, stability, compartmentation, propulsion, electrical/auxiliary systems, damage control, administration. Basic concepts of theory/design for steam, gas turbine, diesel, nuclear propulsion.

subject: NAV
name: Ship Systems II
fullname: Ship Systems II: Science and Technology in Naval Weapons Systems
info: Detection, evaluation, threat analysis, weapon selection, delivery, guidance, explosives. Physical aspects of radar, underwater sound. Facets of command, control, communications as means of weapons system integration.

subject: NAV
name: Naval Lab III
info: Instruction and training in basic military subjects and professional development, including military leadership, close order drill, marksmanship, honors and ceremonies, personnel inspections, and computer-based war game simulations.  Classes and small group seminars on leadership and ethical issues with case studies.prereq: Jr enrolled in NROTC

subject: NAV
name: Navigation I Pilot & Celestial
fullname: Navigation I: Piloting and Celestial Navigation
info: National/international nautical rules of the road, seamanship, tactical maneuvering/signaling, relative motion, vector-analysis, formation tactics, ship employment, ship behavior/characteristics. Application of maneuvering board in solving motion problems.  (part 1)

subject: NAV
name: Navigation II (Ops)
fullname: Navigation II: Seamanship and Ship Operations
info: National/international nautical rules of the road, seamanship, tactical maneuvering/signaling, relative motion, vector-analysis, formation tactics, ship employment, ship behavior/characteristics. Application of maneuvering board in solving motion problems.prereq: 3301

subject: NAV
name: Maneuver Warfare
info: Fundamentals of Maneuver Warfare (FMW) is a detailed look at broad aspects of warfare and their interactions with maneuver warfare doctrine, with a focus on the United States Marine Corps. Throughout the course there is a strong focus on Leadership, as the fundamental purpose of this course is to develop the skills, knowledge, leadership background and mentality necessary for a successful Marine Corps Officer.

subject: NAV
name: Evolution of War
info: Great military leaders of history. Development of warfare, from dawn of recorded history to present. Focuses on effect of major military theorists, strategists, tacticians, technological developments.

subject: NAV
name: Naval Lab IV
info: Instruction and training in basic military subjects and professional development, including military leadership, close order drill, marksmanship, honors and ceremonies, personnel inspections, and computer-based war game simulations.  Classes and small group seminars on leadership and ethical issues with case studies.prereq: Sr enrolled in NROTC

subject: NAV
name: Leadership & Mgmt I
info: Advanced study of organizational behavior/management. Major behavioral theories examined in detail. Practical applications. Exercises, case studies, seminar discussions.

subject: NAV
name: Leadership & Ethics
info: Junior officer role. Responsibilities faced as leader, manager, professional officer of Naval Services. Develops specific competencies in areas of leadership, management, professional administration, development. Emphasizes Naval Service ethics, core values.prereq: NAV 4401W
